message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and imaging findings suggest that the patient has tuberculosis, which is commonly treated with isoniazid. Isoniazid can cause optic neuritis, hence the need for monthly ophthalmologic examinations. The mechanism of action of isoniazid is the inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis, which is a component of the cell wall of mycobacteria. This corresponds to option (B).
